content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is not too complicated to get the idea behind the test cases but a nice quick practice for processing a whole stream to some output.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one. My solution:
print(*['Buzz' if x[-1] in '02468' else 'Lightning' if x[-1] in '13579' else x for x in input().split()])

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Not very difficult, I think it's ok for reverse. My solution : 
print(" ".join(i if not i.isdigit() else 
    "Buzz" if not int(i)%2 else "Lightning" 
    for i in message.split() ))

OK, my first reaction was 'just another replacement one', but solving it was funny

My answer :

sed -r 's/[0-9]*[02468]/Buzz/g;s/[0-9]*[13579]/Lightning/g'

Your validators should contain words, as tests do

Thank you Alze üôè !
Nice oneliner ^^
I fixed the validators, thanks for the feedback.

And yes for the next one, I'm already thinking of something completely different :-)
